title: NumPy Basics
subject: Data Science
theory: NumPy (Numerical Python) brings high-performance multidimensional array objects to Python. Unlike Python lists, NumPy arrays are homogenous (same data type) and stored contiguously in memory, making them much faster.
syntax:
import numpy as np
arr = np.array([1, 2, 3])

examples.code:
import numpy as np
arr = np.array([1, 2, 3])
print(arr * 2)
examples.explanation: Vectorization: Operations apply to all elements at once without loops.

common_mistakes.correction: Always use vectorized operations. Loops are 100x slower in Python.
common_mistakes.example: for i in arr: sum += i  // BAD

interview_questions.question: Why is NumPy faster than Python lists?
interview_questions.answer: Contiguous memory allocation, type homogeneity (no type checking per element), and SIMD vectorization capabilities.

real_world_use_cases.description: Images are stored as 3D NumPy arrays (Height, Width, RGB channels).

summary: NumPy is the foundation upon which Pandas and Scikit-Learn are built.
